full_summary:
### Transport Canada Solicits Feedback on Medical Physician Consultation Services

**Solicitation Number:** T8080-230078

Transport Canada invites stakeholders to submit feedback regarding the provision of Civil Aviation and Marine Medical Physician Consultation Services. The purpose of this Letter of Interest (LOI) is to understand how the market is positioned to offer integrated consultation services for Transport Canada aviation and marine personnel.

**Request Details:**
The desired services include intake, assessment, and coordination of multiple medical consultation specialists for:

* Aeromedical certification of aviation personnel
* Marine medical certification of marine personnel
* Support with file review and policy development

These services are required for aviation medicine in major regions of Canada, including the National Capital Region, Quebec and Ontario, the Prairie Provinces, and the Pacific Region. Marine medicine services will be required across Canada.

**Non-Competitive Process**
Please note that this inquiry is not a formal solicitation or invitation to submit proposals. It is not a commitment to issue a future solicitation or award a contract. Respondents will not be reimbursed for any costs incurred in participating in this LOI. Comments and input will be accepted up to the date a formal solicitation is published.

**Instructions**

* Interested parties must submit feedback in writing to [jessica.hanschell@tc.gc.ca](mailto:jessica.hanschell@tc.gc.ca) or in the form provided [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6354/t8080-230078-letter-of-interest-%28loi-en.pdf) (English) or [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6354/t8080-230078-lettre-dinteret-%28li-fr.pdf) (French).

**Important Notes:**

* Commercial-in-confidence information will be treated accordingly.
* Participation in this LOI is encouraged but not mandatory.

Transport Canada will use the feedback received to inform its future procurement decisions, but it is under no obligation to award a contract based on the information submitted.

Note:
Transport Canada may be required by law to disclose proprietary or commercially-sensitive information in response to access to information requests. Participants should identify any sensitive information in their submissions.
